title: Punjab CM meets Governor, seeks space for AAP’s office
content: The Chief Minister said AAP is a national party and it fulfils all conditions for having its office like other political parties in Chandigarh.

title: Disruption of flight services leaves passengers stranded at Kochi airport
content: Services to Doha, Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Muscat, Ras al-Khaimah, Bahrain, Dammam, and Kuwait from Kochi airport cancelled; passengers asked to stay updated and check flight status regularly

title: Double-engine government has become a double burden on A.P., says CPI(M)

content: ISKCON vice president Radharamn Das said that around 30 lakh people have already visited the Jagannath Temple at Digha since its inauguration on April 30

content: Nine persons including a minor were arrested by Ganjam police while three others were absconding in connection with the incident

content: The Commission submitted its report to the first AIADMK government, headed by M.G. Ramachandran, on September 26, 1977

title: Tamil Nadu InFocus | When a prisoner was made to ‘run like a horse’
content: In his autobiography Ungalil Oruvan, Chief Minister M.K. Stalin described the Madras Central Prison during the Emergency as a “torture camp” that echoed with wails

title: The death of Chittibabu, who formed a ‘human shield’ to protect Stalin in jail
content: Chittibabu, who was imprisoned in the Madras Central Prison during Emergency, died of injuries from a brutal lathi assault after shielding a young M.K. Stalin inside a prison cell

title: Tamil Nadu InFocus | Locked up with seven inmates, Stalin was beaten, harassed, and fed kali
content: During Emergency, the then 23-year-old M.K. Stalin spent several months imprisoned in the Madras Central Prison. Later, deposing before the Justice M.M. Ismail Commission, he recounted the brutal treatment meted out to him and the other inmates by the jailers

title: India trails in critical tech, particularly semiconductor tech
content: The U.S. and China lead across five critical tech sectors: semiconductors, AI, biotechnology, space and quantum

title: Tamil Nadu government to give 4% reservation in promotion to its staff with benchmark disabilities
content: However, having regard to the type of work carried out, the government can exempt any of its establishments from the provisions of the reservation in consultation with the State Commissioner for Persons with Disabilities

title: Twins to Chennai’s Munro statue
content: The statue of Thomas Munro in Chennai was one of three equestrian statues of sculptor Francis Chantrey

title: Bombay High Court gives 4 weeks to Maharashtra to fix school safety rules
content: The State Department of School Education and Sports issues a Government Resolution on May 13, introducing new guidelines and safety measures for children in schools after the Badlapur sexual assault case’s court order

title: Migrants from Bengal being detained in BJP ruled states for speaking in Bengali: CM Mamata
content: The Chief Minister said such detentions are being done in BJP ruled states and on some occasion the residents of  West Bengal are being “pushed back” in Bangladesh.

title: Bombay High Court stands with BJP MLA’s election victory, dismisses petition against marital status
content: The High Court dismisses the petition challenging  BJP MLA Rajendra Dhedya Gavit’s election, based on his marital status disclosure and lack of necessary material facts

title: Iran Hangs 3 Israeli Men Accused For Spying
content: Iran said Wednesday that it executed three men accused of spying for Israel, the day after a truce between the two countries came into effect.

title: "It's Done": Indian Origin Democrat Zohran Mamdani Wins New York Mayoral Primary
content: Zohran Mamdani, a 33-year-old Indian-origin Muslim and a left-leaning socialist, has won New York City's Democratic mayoral primary, defeating former governor Andrew Cuomo.

title: First Pic Of Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukhla Seated Inside Dragon Spacecraft
content: As India eagerly waits for its giant cosmic leap, the first visuals from inside the SpaceX spacecraft are flashing on TV screens. The visuals show Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, all geared up, along with three others, for the big launch

title: RFK Jr's Medical Panel To Review Contested Vaccine Claims
content: A vaccine panel appointed by US Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. will revisit long-settled science and spotlight rare risks linked to childhood immunizations in a meeting beginning Wednesday

title: NASA Axiom Mission Launch LIVE: Axiom-4 Mission With, India's Shubhanshu Shukla, To Launch Shortly
content: Axiom Mission LIVE Updates: After several delays, India's Shubhanshu Shukla is all set to travel to the International Space Station on Wednesday on an American commercial mission with three other astronauts.

title: In One Hour, Captain Shubhanshu Shukla Will Take Off For Space: 10 Points
content: Axiom Mission 4 to the International Space Station -- carrying India's Shubhanshu Shukla and three other astronauts -- will lift off at 12.01 pm. The astronauts have boarded the Dragon spacecraft.

title: "Looking Forward To Present India's Vision": Rajnath Singh Ahead Of SCO Meet
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh in Qingdao for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) meet, aiming to strengthen regional peace and urges action against terrorism. He is the first Indian union Minister to visit China since 2020.

title: Woman Steps Out After Car Breaks Down, Speeding Bolero Tosses Her In Air
content: A woman was killed in a hit-and-run incident involving a speeding goods vehicle in Hyderabad. The reckless driving was caught on CCTV cameras.

title: Australian Companies Recover Faster With Tougher Regulations After Cyberattack: Study
content: Australian companies have sharply reduced the time it takes to recover from cyberattacks, a sign of improved preparedness amid heightened regulatory pressure following high-profile breaches at Optus and Medibank.

title: Vande Mataram: The Song Shubhanshu Shukla Listened To Before Space Trip
content: A fighter pilot to the core, Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's favourite song is from actor Hrithik Roshan's 2024 film 'Fighter'.

title: As Indian Awaits Historic Feat, Here's What Delayed Axiom Mission 6 Times
content: The Axiom Mission 4, carrying Indian Air Force's Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla and three other astronauts to space, will lift off from Kennedy Space Centre in Florida after a series of delays due to weather and technical issues.

title: Justice After 32 Years: Postmaster Acquitted By High Court Over Minor Error
content: After a legal battle spanning more than three decades, postmaster Mankaram from Betul has finally been acquitted by the Madhya Pradesh High Court in a 32-year-old case that began with a minor clerical lapse.

title: China Accuses CIA Making "Absurd" Attempt To Recruit Spies
content: Beijing accused the US Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) on Wednesday of making an "absurd" attempt to recruit Chinese citizens via videos posted to social media.

title: "Emergency Was Reflection Of Congress' Anti-Democratic Mentality": Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said on Wednesday the Emergency was not a national necessity but a reflection of the anti-democratic mentality of the Congress and "just one person", a reference to then prime minister Indira Gandhi.

title: Brazilian Hiker Found Dead 4 Days After Falling Off Indonesian Volcano
content: A Brazilian hiker died after falling from a cliff while trekking on an active volcano in Indonesia, her family and authorities confirmed.

title: 4 Dead After Fire Breaks Out In Chemical Factory In Delhi's Rithala
content: Four persons died in a fire that erupted in a chemical factory in Rithala in northwest Delhi, police said on Wednesday.

title: Japan Conducts First Domestic Surface-To-Ship Missile Test
content: Japan on Wednesday called its first surface-to-ship missile test within its territory necessary training given the current "severe security environment", as it boosts military capacity to counter China.

title: Zohran Mamdani's Net Worth Revealed After New York Mayoral Primary Win
content: Zohran Mamdani is all set to be the Democratic nominee for New York City mayor after former Governor Andrew Cuomo conceded the race to him.

title: SpaceX's Falcon 9: All About Rocket Taking Shubhanshu Shukla To Space
content: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla is set to lift off today aboard SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket as part of the Axiom Mission 4 (Ax-4).

title: Weather 90% Favourable For Axiom-4 Mission: SpaceX
content: After multiple delays, Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla and three others are all set to travel to the International Space Station on Wednesday with SpaceX announcing that the weather was 90 per cent favourable for lift-off.

title: Reds' Burns fans 1st 5 hitters in his MLB debut
content: Chase Burns, a 22-year old right-hander and the No. 2 pick in 2024, became the first starting pitcher in the expansion era to strike out the first five batters he faced in his major league debut during the Reds' 5-4 win over the Yankees on Tuesday.

title: Arbiter says NFL urged clubs to limit guarantees
content: An arbiter ruled in January that there was no collusion by NFL clubs in response to a grievance filed by the NFL Players Association in 2022 that alleged the league and its member clubs colluded to restrict or limit fully guaranteed player contracts.

title: 2B Marte in tears after fan's taunt about late mom
content: Diamondbacks second baseman Ketel Marte was visibly upset and in tears on the field after a fan yelled something about his late mother during Wednesday night's game against the White Sox at Chicago's Rate Field.

title: Pirates remove Cruz after he loses track of outs
content: Pittsburgh Pirates veteran outfielder Oneil Cruz, 26, said he lost track of the outs in the seventh inning, when he didn't run out a double-play grounder, a move that led to his removal in his club's 9-3 loss to the Milwaukee Brewers on Tuesday night.

content: Claudio Echeverri is being assessed by Manchester City's medical staff, sources have told ESPN, after the injury he picked up against Al Ain left him on crutches and needing a protective boot.

content: New Real Madrid signing Franco Mastantuono has said a conversation with coach Xabi Alonso convinced him to join the club.

content: Amid Liverpool interest, Newcastle are doing what they can to keep Alexander Isak from leaving. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Norman closing in on top spot at welterweight
content: Brian Norman Jr. earned his third consecutive KO win to retain the WBO welterweight title. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Jake Paul vs. Julio Cesar Chavez Jr.: How to find betting value for the fight
content: Taking Jake Paul to win doesn't offer much value, but there are other bets to consider for Saturday's bout.

title: Waiver wire: Find someone like Jo Adell?
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire. Rumor has it you should be looking at the Angels outfield.

title: Halwa, and a surprise: What astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla is taking to ISS
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is set to make history as he embarks on the Axiom Mission 4 to the ISS, marking India's return to space after 41 years. Carrying scientific instruments and personal mementos, including Indian sweets to share with his crewmates, Shukla also holds a secret souvenir for his mentor, Rakesh Sharma.

title: 'Darkest chapters': PM Modi flays Congress for 1975 Emergency
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, on the 50th anniversary of the Emergency, called the imposition of the Emergency a dark chapter in India's history and a violation of the Constitution. He accused the Congress party of arresting democracy and highlighted the sacrifices of those who fought against the Emergency. Apart from him, other BJP members also slammed the Congress for 1975 Emergency.

title: 'Fake news': Trump goes ballistic after US intel contradicts his Iran claims
content: Donald Trump refuted a CNN report alleging the US strikes on Iran's nuclear program were ineffective, labeling it "FAKE NEWS" and asserting the sites were "completely destroyed." White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt also dismissed the report as "flat-out wrong," while Special Envoy Steve Witkoff condemned the intelligence leak as "treasonous," insisting on the site's obliteration.

title: Accenture reports biggest quarterly drop, as numbers fall by ..; US remains top revenue contributor
content: Accenture's Q3 FY25 saw an 8% revenue increase, reaching $7.7 billion, fueled by AI service demand. Despite a gross margin dip and workforce reduction, the company raised its revenue growth forecast. Generative AI bookings surged, contributing significantly to overall revenue, with the Americas leading regional performance. The company projects strong Q4 revenues, emphasizing its role as a reinvention partner.

title: WATCH: Jaiswal takes England fans' mocking like a champ - dances it off!
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's century in the first Test against England was overshadowed by his poor fielding. He dropped four catches, costing India crucial runs. England fans mocked him. Ben Duckett and Joe Root led England to victory. Gautam Gambhir defended Jaiswal. Shubman Gill acknowledged the dropped catches and batting collapses contributed to the loss. He hopes for improvement in future matches.

title: 'Undeclared emergency': Cong slams Modi govt; alleges 5-fold attack on democracy
content: The Congress party has launched a strong attack on the Modi government, alleging an "undeclared emergency" and a five-fold assault on Indian democracy. They accuse the government of weakening the Constitution, using tax terrorism, controlling the media, misusing investigative agencies, and suppressing civil liberties.

title: New US Visa rule: Visa applicants to change privacy setting on FB, Instagram; What embassy said
content: The US embassy in India has announced that applicants for F, M, and J non-immigrant visas must now make their social media accounts public. This new guideline aims to help U.S. officials verify the identity and eligibility of visa applicants during the security screening process. The embassy stated this change is necessary to facilitate vetting and establish admissibility under U.S.

title: ‘Top priority right now’: Amidst Air India crisis, N Chandra takes charge of day-to-day ops
content: Following the tragic Ahmedabad plane crash, Tata Group Chairman N Chandrasekaran has assumed direct oversight of Air India's operations, focusing on safety, government relations, and staff welfare. Drawing from historical precedent within the Tata Group, this move aims to provide focused leadership during a critical period.

title: IND vs ENG: How much did dropped catches, batting collapse hurt India? In numbers
content: India faced a tough 5-wicket defeat against England in the first Test, despite a strong batting performance with five centuries and setting a 371-run target. Crucial dropped catches and batting collapses in both innings hampered India's chances. While the top order shone, the lower order struggled, contributing significantly less to the overall score, ultimately costing India the match.

title: 'Amateurish': China mocks CIA's spy recruitment videos
content: Beijing has strongly denounced the CIA's social media campaign aimed at recruiting Chinese citizens, labeling it an "absurd" and "clumsy" attempt. The MSS criticized the videos as a "naked political provocation" and warned against inciting betrayal. This incident highlights the ongoing espionage tensions between the US and China, with both countries accusing each other of intelligence activities.

title: AI heat at Amazon: CEO says jobs may go; staff respond with ‘Nothing more motivating on a Tuesday’
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy warned corporate employees about upcoming workforce reductions due to AI-driven "efficiency gains." This announcement sparked internal backlash, with employees expressing concerns about job displacement and over-reliance on AI. Jassy envisions a future dominated by AI agents, but workers question the impact on leadership and the reliability of these systems.

title: WATCH: After Headingley howler, old video of Jaiswal dropping catches resurfaces
content: Despite Yashasvi Jaiswal's century in the Leeds Test, his fielding woes became a talking point after dropping four catches, a first for an Indian in a Test innings. An old video of him missing catches in a previous match resurfaced. However, coach Gautam Gambhir and Jasprit Bumrah defended Jaiswal, citing difficult conditions.

title: Gold price prediction: Where is gold rate headed amidst easing Iran-Israel tensions?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold rates are declining due to easing Iran-Israel tensions and reduced demand for safe-haven assets. Despite hitting an all-time high last week, gold prices have consolidated, with bearish sentiment emerging. Analysts suggest a 'Sell on Rise' strategy, anticipating a test of downside support levels in both MCX and international spot markets.

title: On This Day: In 1983, Kapil's devils stunned the mighty West Indies
content: In 1983, under Kapil Dev's leadership, India defied expectations at the Cricket World Cup. Despite a weak one-day record and being dismissed for a mere 183 in the final, the team rallied against the dominant West Indies. A stunning victory, highlighted by Kapil Dev's catch, secured India's first major international trophy and a place in cricketing history.

title: Indian-origin Zohran Mamdani likely to become next New York mayor
content: In a stunning upset, Zohran Mamdani, a democratic socialist of Indian origin, defeated former governor Andrew Cuomo in New York City's Democratic mayoral primary. Mamdani, leading with 43% of the vote, awaits final ranked-choice tabulations. Cuomo conceded, congratulating Mamdani. If confirmed, Mamdani would be the city’s first Muslim and Indian American mayor.

title: Diljit's Sardaar Ji 3: Makers respond to Hania controversy; say “We stand united with our country…”
content: Amidst controversy surrounding Hania Aamir's casting in 'Sardaar Ji 3' post-Pahalgam attack, the makers clarified that the film was shot before the escalating tensions between India and Pakistan. Standing in solidarity with India, they've decided against releasing the movie domestically, opting for an overseas release only. Diljit Dosanjh supports the producer's decision, emphasizing the pre-existing circumstances of the film's production.

title: AP PGECET result 2025 declared: 93.55% pass, Female candidates outnumber males among qualifiers
content: The AP PGECET 2025 results have been officially declared, with a notable 93.55% pass rate. Out of 14,231 registered candidates, 11,244 qualified for admission to M.Tech, M.Pharmacy, and Pharma D programmes. Female candidates slightly outnumbered their male counterparts. Minister Nara Lokesh praised the outcome and reaffirmed the government’s commitment to accessible, transparent higher education.

title: Axiom-4 mission with Shubhanshu Shukla set to launch today; check time
content: Axiom Mission 4, featuring ISRO astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, is scheduled to launch to the International Space Station on Wednesday, with SpaceX reporting favorable weather conditions. The mission, utilizing a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft and Falcon 9 rocket, will lift off from NASA's Kennedy Space Center.

title: ‘Pushed her off the roof’: Delhi girl pushed to death by stalker in burqa
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi, 19-year-old Neha was allegedly pushed to her death from a rooftop by Taufiq, a man she once considered a brother. The father, Surender Kumar, witnessed the horrific event after Taufiq, disguised in a burqa, attacked Neha.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,100; BSE Sensex up over 300 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday following global cues. While Nifty50 was above 25,100, BSE Sensex was up over 300 points.

title: Not 'obliterated'? US intel says Iran can restore nuke sites 'within months'
content: Conflicting reports emerge regarding the success of US air strikes on Iran's nuclear program. While President Trump claimed complete obliteration, intelligence assessments suggest key facilities were damaged but not destroyed, potentially recoverable within months. Despite White House denials and a fragile ceasefire, experts warn Iran retains the capacity to reconstitute its nuclear program, raising concerns about long-term implications.

title: Honeymoon murder case: Sonam, Raj confess to killing Raja; cops say motive clear
content: Sonam, the prime suspect in her husband Raja Raghuvanshi's murder, had business ties with Raj Kushwaha and was involved in a love triangle with him. Police investigations reveal that Sonam and Raj confessed to the crime, motivated by their desire to advance their business interests and relationship. Authorities are exploring all angles, with further investigation pending.

title: 'We've no money': Karnataka HM's quip stirs row; later clarifies
content: Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara's lighthearted comments about a shortage of funds in the state government have sparked a political controversy after a video of his speech went viral. Parameshwara clarified that his remarks were made in jest and were misconstrued, emphasizing the state's fiscal strength and commitment to welfare schemes.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for June 25, 2025 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares' Mehul Kothari suggests buying Ramco Systems, Minda Corp, and JSW Infrastructure. Ramco Systems shows reversal potential from support at ₹390, targeting ₹480. Minda Corp is retesting a breakout zone near ₹510, aiming for ₹550. JSW Infra is poised for a breakout above ₹314, potentially reaching ₹340, after forming a double bottom pattern.

title: 'He was going to kiss ...': Swifties lose it over Taylor & Travis’s PDA moment
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce made their first red carpet appearance. The couple attended Tight End University's opening night in Nashville. The event was co-founded by Kelce. Swift wore a gingham co-ord set. Kelce sported a white knit shirt and shorts. They shared a kiss, which went viral. Swift is looking forward to the upcoming NFL season.

title: Chhattisgarh horror: Disabled killed, then encased in cement & put in suitcase; married couple held
content: A disabled man's body, found encased in cement within a suitcase and steel trunk in Raipur, led police to a married couple at Delhi airport. Lawyer Ankit Upadhyay and his wife are suspected of murdering Kishore Paikra over a land brokerage dispute.

title: For 2 decades, suicide among top 2 causes of death of young Indians
content: A recent analysis of cause of death reports reveals a concerning trend in India, where suicide remains a leading cause of death among young individuals aged 15-29. Between 2020 and 2022, suicides accounted for 17.1% of deaths in this age group, ranking second only to road accidents.

title: Once invincible, now vulnerable: Is this India’s worst Test era?
content: England's dominant victory at Headingley has put India's Test cricket dominance under scrutiny. Despite centuries from Gill, Rahul, and Pant, India's sole win in nine Tests contrasts sharply with the consistent success of England, Australia, and South Africa. Root's unbeaten innings secured England's record chase, exposing India's fielding lapses and tail-end collapses.

title: 'I Race Athletes, Not YouTubers': Tyreek Hill Slams IShowSpeed as Olympic Clash Collapses
content: A highly anticipated race between Tyreek Hill and Noah Lyles was canceled, leading to online drama. Hill criticized IShowSpeed for allegedly turning the event into a spectacle after Lyles withdrew. Speed's fans defended him, highlighting his role in generating buzz, sparking a debate about the intersection of sports and influencer culture.

title: Root on cusp of smashing Tendulkar’s record as Eng stun Ind at Headingley
content: Joe Root's composed, unbeaten half-century guided England to a historic victory in the Headingley Test, frustrating India's hopes. Root's innings, a blend of poise and precision, complemented the earlier explosive start by Duckett and Crawley. This win highlights England's 'Bazball' approach, showcasing both boldness and control.

title: Diabetes: Can calf raises help lower sugar levels? Man shares how this simple exercise helped him
content: With diabetes on the rise, a viral video features Rahul Lalchandani sharing how he lowered his HbA1c levels through lifestyle changes. A key tip from his nutritionist involves performing seated calf raises for 10 minutes after meals. Studies suggest this exercise activates the soleus muscle, potentially lowering sugar levels by up to 52% by improving insulin response and glucose uptake.

title: ‘Kuberaa’ box office Day 6: Dhanush-Nagarjuna starrer inches toward ₹61 crore; continues strong weekday run
content: Dhanush and Nagarjuna's 'Kuberaa' is maintaining a steady performance at the box office, accumulating Rs 60.71 crore in India after six days. The film had a strong opening weekend, driven by positive word-of-mouth and the actors' fanbases, though weekday collections have seen a typical drop. With a stellar cast and no major releases on the horizon, 'Kuberaa' is expected to continue its run in cinemas.

title: Pant creates a rare record no batter wants as India choke at Headingley
content: Rishabh Pant's exceptional batting prowess was on full display at Headingley, where he scored centuries in both innings, reaffirming his reputation as India's most fearless Test batter abroad. Despite his heroics and a crucial partnership with KL Rahul, India suffered a loss, highlighting the need for greater team support to convert Pant's individual brilliance into victories.

title: 'It’s not a fair matchup': Patrick Mahomes’ mother shares views on trans athletes, faces backlash
content: Randi Mahomes, mother of Patrick Mahomes, shares her views on transgender athletes. She speaks about fairness in women's sports. She emphasizes biological differences. She suggests separate categories for competition. Her comments reignite a national debate. This debate concerns fairness and inclusion. It also concerns athletic integrity. Her stance arrives amid ongoing discussions. Several states are tightening rules on trans participation.

title: 'Pushed into deep sea, but he’ll swim'- Gambhir on Gill’s first Test as captain
content: Gautam Gambhir has urged critics to give Shubman Gill time to prove himself as India's Test captain, despite a recent defeat against England. Gambhir praised Gill's leadership as "phenomenal," highlighting his first-innings century under pressure. He acknowledged the challenges of captaining in tough conditions and expressed confidence in Gill's potential for success.

title: Novo Nordisk’s Wegovy debuts in India: How it works, who it’s for, and how much it costs
content: Novo Nordisk has launched Wegovy in India, a weight-loss drug challenging Eli Lilly's Mounjaro. Available by June 2025, Wegovy is a once-weekly injectable using a user-friendly FlexTouch pen. Targeting India's large obese population, Novo Nordisk aims to capture a significant share of the ₹576 crore anti-obesity market.

title: Ostrava Golden Spike: Neeraj Chopra clinches top prize with 85.29m throw, only athlete to breach 85m-mark at event
content: Neeraj Chopra clinched the men's javelin title at the Ostrava Golden Spike meet in the Czech Republic with a throw of 85.29 metres. This victory follows his recent triumph at the Paris Diamond League. Douw Smit of South Africa secured second place, while Anderson Peters from Grenada finished third in the competition directed by Jan Zelezny.

title: Rajasthan horror: French tourist raped in Udaipur apartment; suspect on the run
content: In Udaipur, a 30-year-old French tourist reported being raped by a man she met at a café. Puspraj, alias Siddharth, offered to show her around, but allegedly assaulted her at his rented apartment in Sukher on Sunday night. The survivor filed a police complaint after undergoing medical tests.

title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ box office collection day 5: Aamir Khan starrer maintains steady pace
content: Aamir Khan and Genelia D’Souza's ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ has garnered significant audience attention, earning over Rs. 70 crore within five days of its release. Despite a dip on Monday, the film maintained its momentum on Tuesday, reaching a total collection of Rs. 75.15 crore. The movie, directed by R.S. Prasanna, is considered a spiritual sequel to ‘Taare Zameen Par’.

title: What the CWC can tell us about comparing MLS to the Premier League and more
content: MLS is worse than the Tunisian league, but not by as much -- and it's also worse than MLS . the Brazilian league is better than the Premier League and the Champions League . Botafogo beat Paris Saint-Germain, Flamengo beat Chelsea, Al Hilal drew with Real Madrid .
